result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Troy A. Hecke

records.addlTxt:
9:06 AM Defendant Troy A. Hecke in court, in custody.  Attorney Jon G Spansail in court for Troy A. Hecke.  Prosecuting attorney DeShea D. Morrow in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Atty Spansail heard - copy of comp, requests prelim, waives time limits.
ADA heard - deft already posted bond in this matter, Deft being heard on different matter.
Deft waives time limits.
Court schedules prelim and arraignment w/parties.
9:11 am
Preliminary hearing scheduled for November 15, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Arraignment scheduled for November 30, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

8:49 AM Defendant Troy A. Hecke not in court.  Attorney Jon G Spansail in court for Troy A. Hecke.  Prosecuting attorney Kathryn E Heineck in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Atty Spansail heard - Deft in custody in Brown County.
ADA heard on attempts to contact for video, requests matter be continued.
Court grants request and schedules.
8:50 am
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for October 10, 2022 at 09:00 am.

records.addlTxt:
11:35 AM Defendant Troy A. Hecke appeared by video, in custody.  Prosecuting attorney DeShea D. Morrow in court for the State of Wisconsin.   Atty Spansail appears in court for defendant for bail purposes only.
Court calls case
Atty Spansail is being heard regarding additional information needed before they know if defendant qualifies.
DA is being heard on bail
Atty Spansail is being heard
Court sets $1000 cash bail - Sign Waiver of Extradition.  No possession or consumption of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription.
